meta.content: Best High School Bronze Award Osage High School is recognized in the National Rankings and earned a bronze medal. Schools are ranked based on their performance on state-required tests and how well they prepare students for college.

link.title: Osage Community Schools » Feed

div.p:
The Mission of the Osage Community School is to
sustain & enhance a caring community to produce
enthusiasm for lifelong learning.

div.p: Osage High School is recognized in the National Rankings and earned a bronze medal. Schools are ranked based on their performance on state-required tests and how well they prepare students for college.

p.span:
ANNUAL NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATION (Policy 102.E2)
The Osage Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study: Agricultural Education, Business, Health Occupations, Industrial Technology, Family and Consumer Sciences, and Marketing Education. It is the policy of the Osage Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact Tim Hejhal, High School Principal, 820 Sawyer Drive, Osage, IA 50461, 641.732.3102, or Email Tim.

br.span: Students, parents, employees and others doing business with or performing services for the Osage Community School District are hereby notified that the Osage Community School District not to discriminate in its educational programs and its employment practices on the basis of age (for employment), color, race, religion, creed, sex, gender, marital status (for programs), socioeconomic status (for programs), national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact Tim Hejhal, High School Principal, Osage Community Schools, 820 Sawyer Drive, Osage, IA 50461, at 641-732-3102 or Email Tim. This person has been designated by the school district to coordinate the school district’s efforts to comply with the regulations implementing Title VI, title VII, title IX, the ADA, §§ 504 and Iowa Code 280.3.
